byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Alexander Burns, Steve Eder, Thomas Kaplan and Jeremy Merrill, and research by Susan C. Beachy and Doris Burke.
byline.original: By SUSANNE CRAIG and DAVID W. CHEN

abstract: Donald J Trump has flaunted his New York City roots during his presidential campaign and given impression of being power broker at home, but solid evidence of claim is scarce; Trump's real estate holdings are modest compared to those of most powerful developers, while insiders say his influence in city has lessened considerably since 1980s; past business associates criticize Trump's risk-taking and conduct.
lead_paragraph: As a Republican candidate for president, Mr. Trump has played up his stature in the city of his birth. But his local real estate holdings are limited, and some banks and contractors are leery of working with him.

headline.main: Donald Trump in New York: Deep Roots, but Little Influence
headline.print_headline: Trump in New York: Deep Roots, but Little Sway

snippet: As a Republican candidate for president, Mr. Trump has played up his stature in the city of his birth. But his local real estate holdings are limited, and some banks and contractors are leery of working with him.
